dc:description: The USH1C gene has been associated with ARNSHL in at least 5 probands in 5 publications. 5 unique variants (missense, frameshift, large deletion) have been reported in humans, and variants in this gene segregated with disease in 5 additional family members (PMID: 12107438, 9653658). However, several variants were not scored due to lack of evidence for pathogenicity (PMID: 12136232). USH1C was first associated with this disease in humans in 1998 (Jain et al.). This gene-disease association is supported by 2 mouse models with deletions in the USH1C gene who were deaf but lacked the retinal phenotype of Usher Syndrome I as well as 1 expression study which showed that the longer transcript including the PDZ domain (which is thought to be the region affected to cause NSHL) was only expressed in the ear and not the retina. However, the mouse model from Williams 2009 was not scored because Johnson 2003 found that the mice displayed retinal degeneration at 9 months in addition to circling behavior (PMID: 19324851, 14519688). In summary, there is limited evidence to support this gene-disease association. Although more evidence is needed to support a causal role, no convincing evidence has emerged that contradicts the gene-disease association.
curationReasonDescription:
Decrease segregation score to 1 point. Candidate gene sequencing with a LOD of 4.4.

There was an LMM case with nonsyndromic HL with homozygous p.Gln723X, which meets BS1 but was signed out as LP. Patient had progressive moderate HL, was 12 yo at time of testing, and was tested in 2013 by OtoChip. These variants are in alternatively spliced exons that are expressed in the ear but not retina in mice. (0.5 pts)

Therefore, 1.5 pts for LOF variant, 0.5 pts for LMM case, and 1 pts for segregation (3 points genetic total)

evidence.dc:description: The mouse model described has no retinal phenotype but exhibits hearing loss due to a deletion in the USH1C gene. Therefore, it is described to be a model for DFNB18. They specifically noted that at 9 months of age, the dfcr-2J mutants had normal retinas.
evidence.rdfs:label: Spontaneous dfcr-2J from Jackson Laboratory

evidence.dc:description: This mouse model should not be counted due to the reports of retinal degeneration by (Johnson 2003).  Due to circling behavior and the conflicting reports as to whether retinal degeneration occurs this mouse model can not be scored.

It has been reported that the retina of 9 month old dfcr mice show some degeneration in their periphery (Johnson 2003), but this study found no degeneration  in the central or periphery at 12 months. These mice are similar to humans with variants in the PDZ domain in that they only have hearing loss and lack the RP phenotype. These mice also have vestibular dysfunction however as they exhibit circling behavior.
evidence.rdfs:label: Dfcr Mouse

evidence.dc:description: Used RT-PCR analyis of USH1C expression as well as immunohistofluorescence in different mouse tissues to identify different transcripts in different tissues. They found that one specific transcript was found in the inner ear but not in the eye. They claim that amplified fragments consistent with b1 and b2/b3 are seen in cochlea and vestibule.
evidence.rdfs:label: Inner ear-specific expression of transcripts of harmonin

evidence.dc:description: Variant in this family was shown to be a leaky splice variant and didn't lead to full LoF, so this was downgraded to 1.5

evidence.rdfs:label: IV-1
evidence.detectionMethod: PCR of 28 exons and intronic flanks followed by direct sequencing.

evidence.dc:description: This varinat has no further evidence for impact and it was foudn in trans with the WT. Heterozygous mutations are not scored for AR curations

evidence.rdfs:label: Ouyang_American1
evidence.detectionMethod: Exons and intronic flanking sequences of USH1C were sequenced via PCR and then direct sequencing.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: One of 3 American Individuals who were heterozygous for 3 different variants in alternatively spliced exons including Gly431Val in exon B, Arg620Leu and Arg636Cys in exon D. None were known to have associated abnomralities, including impaired vision or night blindness. Both the Gly431Val and Arg620Leu subs were shown to have been inherited from unaffected parents. They cite the 3 reasons why the "other" variant wasn't found in the USH1C gene - intronic, insensitive method, and digenic interaction possibly with harmonin.

evidence.dc:description: Heterozygous individual with missense with no further evidence of gene impact.

evidence.detectionMethod: Exons and intronic flanking sequences of USH1C were sequenced via PCR and then direct sequencing.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: One of 3 American Individuals who were heterozygous for 3 different variants in alternatively spliced exons including Gly431Val in exon B, Arg620Leu and Arg636Cys in exon D. evidence.dc:description: heterozygous proband with missense with no further evidence of impact.

evidence.dc:description: Variant is in exonD of USH1C which is an alternatively spliced exon and this variant was classified as LB by the LMM

evidence.rdfs:label: Chinese Family II-1
evidence.detectionMethod: USH1C coding regions and exon/intron flanking boundaries were sequenced via PCR followed by direct sequencing. No other genes were sequenced.
evidence.previousTestingDescription:
This patient, whose
parents were not known to be consanguineous, had prelingual
bilateral sensorineural deafness (>90dB hearing level
at 500â€“8,000 Hz). Although he had a history of vertigo,
no vestibular function tests had been performed. There
was a history of a sister who was reported to be deaf but
was not available for testing. Neither of the deaf sibs has
night blindness nor other recognized visual abnormalities
at 50 (II.1) and 46 (II.3) years of age and the proband
(II.1) underwent ERG examination with normal results at
38 years old, based on clinical records. The normally
hearing mother and sister (I.2 and II.2) were both found to
be heterozygous for the Pro608Arg mutation. The unaffected
father was not available for testing (Fig. 1a).

evidence.dc:description: This LOD score is above 2 but it is from linkage analysis with only the sequencing of the USH1C gene. Therefore we should only record 1 point of segregation for this.
evidence.rdfs:label: S-11/12

evidence.dc:description: Only 2 affected individuals and LOD score below 2. Not counted in new segregation framework.
evidence.rdfs:label: Chinese Family with USH1C variant
